{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544761,"name":"James Goebel","username":"RummelRobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/bc8723/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T11:45:31.823Z","cooked":"

The team wants to use an Xbox 2.4GHz wireless controller for
the contest. I know that the contest prohibits certain devices
due to bandwidth and interference. Is this legal in FRC? Will it
cause a drop out to the driver station when connected in a heavy
traffic contest?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-02T11:45:31.823Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":106,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":561.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493842,"topic_slug":"is-it-legal-to-use-xbox-wireless-controller-at-2-4-ghz","display_username":"James Goebel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-it-legal-to-use-xbox-wireless-controller-at-2-4-ghz/493842/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3544762,"name":"Maia","username":"HarbringerOfAuroras","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/harbringerofauroras/{size}/165119_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T11:46:49.847Z","cooked":"

This is illegal, only wired controllers are allowed. You can just plug that same Xbox controller into your driver station laptop and use it wired, though.

I think this rule in particular is less about wireless interference and more about making sure there‚Äôs nobody else driving except the drivers. With a wireless controller, someone in the stands could be driving and it would be hard to tell otherwise

frctools.com

Rule R905

R905      *FIELD wireless only. Other than the system provided by the FIELD, no other form of wireless communications shall be used to communicate to, from, or within the OPERATOR CONSOLE.
